fields.description: The issue type field in the new "create new issue" menu is not setting its value to the default issue type.
fields.summary: Create new issue menu does not set issue type to default

fields.description:
If we add a new issue type to a new issue type scheme, and subsequently delete the newly created issue type. The issue type scheme will be left with no issue types. Users are still allowed to access the create new issue page, with no values for issue type in the drop down. They are not allowed to actually create the issue because they cannot select any issue types which results in error message "No issue type selected.".

In addition, the above occurs only when the above issue type scheme is the only one associated with existing projects in the JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Able to have no 'issue type' in an 'issue type scheme'

fields.description: Fixed in SAL 2.0.12, need to upgrade.
fields.summary: Memory Leak in SAL 2.0.10

fields.description:
In any 3.13.X version, the generation of thumbnails for gif images extracted from email does not work properly. The thumbnail appears as an all black image, but clicking on the link shows the gif file correctly. Strangely enough, this problem seems intermittent in 3.13.5, because in that version, the thumbnail is generated correctly _sometimes_.

This seems like a regression from 3.12.3, where the thumbnails are shown correctly.
fields.summary: Thumbnail is not generated for gif files when issue created by mail

fields.description: This screenshot is from a 15" macbook pro using Safari 4 with the default window size
fields.summary: Dashboards with infeasibly large titles cause display issues unless you have a 24" monitor

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA as administration.
2. Create a query like project = A and project =B and save it as filter.
3. Share the filter with everyone.
4. Login as user having only permission on project B.
5. Click on "Manage" tab and search for the query.
6. With the filter name user can see some x number of issues, which belongs to project B.
7. Try to click on filter name to run it.

Result:
1. It takes the user to edit tab and show the query string and give user message that "A value with ID '11560' does not exist for the field 'project'.
2. Execute the same query from JQL query dialog, it return the user all the issues which he/she has permission to view.
3. This seems to be a more reasonable behavior, plus if same filter is use in any of the portlet, we are showing the valid issues.

Expected:
1. The user should be able to see all the allowed issues from Manage tab too.
fields.summary: JQL: Inconsistent behavior if a filter(shared with everyone) having two projects is run by user having only permission on one project from "Manage" or JQL query dialog

fields.description:
I go to the "Gadget Preview" Dashboard and configure a project on the "Issues: Pie Chart" gadget.
After I click save, I get a javascript popup with only the text "error" three times.
Eventually the pie chart is drawn, however there are many stack traces in the logs.
fields.summary: "Issues: Pie Chart" gadget throws "error" message to use and fills up the log with stacktraces, although it seems to produce correct results eventually.
Filter summary does not print "All issues" when the query is empty, or display the default sorting
Issue type field produces errors in simple but not advanced form when the user selects sub tasks or standard types and something else from the list.

fields.description:
Steps-to-Reproduce:
# Language selected in personal settings is Spanish
# logon to JIRA, see screenshot1 - main menu is in Spanish
# Click *NAVEGAR POR EL PROYECTO*
# Click *All Projects*, BTW, Why *All Projects* in English?
# *NAVEGAR POR EL PROYECTO* changes to *BROWSE PROJECTS*, see screenshot2
# Click *BUSCAR INCIDENCIAS* (Find Issues)
# *BROWSE PROJECTS* changes to *NAVEGAR POR EL PROYECTO*

BTW, *HOME* is also not translated to Spanish - *INICIO*
fields.summary: English-Spanish Flip-Flop of "Browse Projects" command in main menu

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click on issues tab and click on "Advanced" to open JQL query dialog.
3. Type any letter or some options where you have auto complete options, now click on any of the drop down menu in the JIRA header.

Result:
1. The UI is bad on firefox 3.0 and Safari where it show the drop down menu options in background of JQL auto complete dialog.
2. In IE the drop down options are on top of JQL auto complete.
3. Its happening for "View" and "tools" drop down in issue navigator if you have some search result.

Expected:
1. The JQL autocomplete dialog should get closed, when user click or choose some other option.
fields.summary: JQL auto complete dialog should get close if user click any where in UI like drop down menus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18119].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

I have checked the JiRA DB structure but didn't find the logs/history when a particular version has been added to the JiRA project. I think current JiRA DB is not storing the version creation date. Currently I can find only the list/sequence in which they has been added.

 We would like to have a more column under 'projectversion' table where it maintain the version creation date, it will help us in filtering when the version has been created. 
It would be great if we capture this version creation date from JiRA frontend instead of running the query on database.


Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: Version creation data to be stored in JiRA DB

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA.
2. In administration click on "General Configuration" and set "JQL Auto-complete Disabled" as on.
3. Login to JIRA as any user. Click on "Issues" tab.
4. Click on "advanced" tab.

Result:
1. The query dialog is not there.

Expected:
1. User should be able to view and perform queries in JQL in all settings.
fields.summary: JQL: JQL query dialog is not visible when user disable auto complete from admin on IE 7.0

fields.description:
If you have lots of sub-options for a cascading select they are all displayed on the one line which stretches the tables. Would be nice if we could wrap this. 

!options.jpg!
fields.summary: Wrap cascading select options when the exceed the page width

fields.description: There is a [memory leak|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SHINDIG-1132] in the Shindig 1.0-incubating class {{XmlUtil}} where they store a Xerces {{DocumentBuilder}} configured with an inner class {{ErrorHandler}} in a thread local. This {{ErrorHandler}} reference prevents the classloader that loaded Shindig from being claimed for GC. In theory the {{DocumentBuilder}} could leak, but in practice this is loaded by the system classloader.
fields.summary: Memory Leak in Apache Shindig

fields.description:
I just upgraded from beta1 to beta2 and now all gadgets/portlets are broken.


GadgetParsingException org.apache.shindig.gadgets.spec.SpecParserException: Malformed XML in file http://xxxxxxxxxx/jira/rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/spec/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:filterstats.xml
fields.summary: Upgraded from beta1 to beta2 and now all the gadgets give: GadgetParsingException

fields.description:
It seems like Outlook ignores JIRA's CSS in email notifications.

For e.g. CSS define fonts to be Arial, however Outlook ignores that and displays Time New Roman.

!outlook.png|thumbnail!

and the same message in Thunderbird

!thunderbird.png|thumbnail!

It appears that Microsoft has done some serious change in HTML and CSS Rendering Capabilities in Outlook 2007. More on that at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa338201.aspx

More on that in [Nick's comment|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12925?focusedCommentId=84941&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_84941] on the linked issue. 
Also,  'there is NO option to switch renderers. In 2003 there is an option to use Word, in 2007 there is NO option to use IE. '

I've attached a raw copy of the test message and its html
fields.summary: Fonts from CSS are ingored in Outlook 2007

fields.description:
On EACJ I was creating an issue and it lost my description.

1. Create new issue
2. Type in title and the description
3. Click the preview button for the description 
4. Click create
fields.summary: Issue description lost when creating issue

Error message not being displayed on create issue page for invalid project

When navigating to this page an error message should be displayed saying "Project does not exist".

{noformat}http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=1000099&issuetype=1{noformat}

*edit* This only occurs if  you go a valid project with valid issue type first and then change the pid to non-existent project in the url and loading the page with the wrong url.
If a similar action is done in regards to issuetype, it displays error "The issue type selected is invalid."

Jira dashboard -> Menu Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards
The tooltip says "Add, remove or search for dashb   oards"
see screenshot

fields.description:
Hi,

My company is using JIRA Enterprise 3.10.2, and they are planning to migrate the DB from MySQL 5.x to SQL Server 64-bit (2005 I think). They would like to know if the 64-bit version of SQL Server is certified as JIRA platform.

Thanks in advance for your comments!!!
fields.summary: SQL Server 64-bit certified as JIRA platform?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18107].
  {panel}

Tracking issues for a software with different branches is a bit more demanding because you have to identify the branches one issue affects and possibly separately fix them on each branch. One and the same issue could have different resolutions per branch, i.e. invalid if a broken functionality does not exist anymore. Nevertheless, all branches have to be checked, likely in different time frames.

Unfortunately JIRA does not support the notion of branches. You have to emulate the behaviour using different schemes like:

    * One issue per version that represents a branch
    * Multiple fix versions for an issue
    * Subtasks for an issue or issue links to ckeck and fix the issue for different versions

Real branching support could help you check on which branch an issue is done, where it has still to be resolved and so on without adding more and more (perhaps loosely connected) issues to your system or forgetting to fix the issue on some branch (no question/warning when resolving an issue with multiple fix versions).
fields.summary: Explicit Branching Support

fields.description:
Some points:

* Auto complete feature need some love in documentation.
* We support auto complete for system fields and custom field(planned)
* It will be good idea to take a demo of the feature and then document it.
* User picker field will show first 15 entries and it will see relevant values as user type values.
* Same for filters.
fields.summary: add documentation on JQL "autocomplete"

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as admin in JIRA and create a custom field of type cascading select.
2. Associate it to the default screen for all project.

Result:
1. Now when user create issue, the custom field is there and it has "None" as valid value for both parent and child options.
2. Now try to search for this custom field in issue navigator, the list has value "any" , which was not there when user created the issue.

Expected:
1. The value for the custom field should be consistent across all dialogs. None value should be present as an option in the issue navigator.

Actual Result:
None option is not available for selection in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in values shown for custom cascading select field in create issue page and issue navigator.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as admin in JIRA and create a custom field of type cascading select.
2. Associate it to the default screen for all project.
3. Now when user create issue, the custom field is there and it has "None" as valid value for both parent and child options.
4. Create a issue having none value for both parent and child options.
5. In JQL query dialog, try to search with value "none" as parent parameter.

Result:
1. It give error message "The option 'none' specified in function 'cascadeOption' is not a valid parent option."

Expected:
1. "None" should be allowed as valid parent parameter for cascadeoption() function.
fields.summary: JQL: None is not a valid parameter for parent option of cascadoption() function

fields.description:
Steps:
1. In JQL query screen, run a query like duedate= -5d

Result:
1. It give error message "Error in the JQL Query: Expecting either 'OR' or 'AND' but got 'd'. (line 1, character 13)"
2. The actual issue is just that user need to put the value in quotes.
 
Expected
1. The message should be more informative.
fields.summary: JQL: Error message can be improved for date field when user doesn't put quotes for value

fields.description:
Taken from

* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/ldap.html

{quote}Technically, this behaviour is due to Credentials (password) checking being a separate operation to user-profile lookups. The profile can be loaded from the JIRA database, but the password looked up from LDAP. Furthermore, multiple credentials providers can be specified (here, LDAP and OSUser), and *if one fails, the other will be used*. This allows non-LDAP users to log in with their JIRA password. {quote}

The entire page is difficult to understand, but in the bolded section how about we just say, if the LDAP lookup fails, then the local JIRA credentials will be used. The way we set up LDAP means that you must have LDAP provider set up before the JIRA provider, so we should make it clearer which will be used first.
fields.summary: LDAP Integration document is confusing about what order passwords will be checked.

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18099]. {panel} It would be useful to be able to set the security level on an issue to include everyone who participated on an issue so if you had a security level that was only the reporter and the assignee, if the issue needs to get reassigned the issue could still be seen by the original assignee. The JIRA Toolkit has a participants custom field which could be used to do this, but unfortunately it doesn't show up in the "User Custom Field Value" section. However, I tried to modify {{/secure/admin/views/issuesecurity/addissuesecurity.jsp}} and hardcoded the participants custom field as an option for the "User Custom Field Value" section: e.g. from JIRA 3.13.4 {code:xml} {code} This seemed to work so It would be good if we picked up any custom field that implements {{UserCFNotificationTypeAware}} (I'm guessing that is why this works).
fields.summary: Allow issue security level to use any custom field that implements UserCFNotificationTypeAware

fields.description:
We have a run query without permission checks on our LuceneQueryProvider but our query factories do not allow this to work correctly.

We need to:
* Add a method on the SearchHandlerManager that will allow you to get a handler without checking permissions
* Examine how much trouble we are in in the QueryFactories and functions (we know we have a problem with version functions)
* Change the code such that we avoid the problem (discuss this with the team before we decide how to proceed).
fields.summary: We have a run query without permission checks on our LuceneQueryProvider but our query factories do not allow this to work correctly

fields.description:
Start typing  a query. For example "affectedVersion is not empty and" type the last "and" manually.
A list of suggestions will popup and when selecting it, the selected word will be concatenate to the last word in the query, w/o a space.
So the query becomes "affectedVersion is not empty andcategory" (i selected category in this example)
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete when selecting a suggestion it doesn't append a space

fields.description: The log files from the JIRA Performance tests show this occurring when trying to send Subscription mail items.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in UserManager.getUsers()

fields.description:
There is a mock error when building JCharting3.14.2 by maven2.0.9. after got source code from "http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Charting+Plugin".
Detail information please see attachment, Anyone say something? what should I do?
Thanks a lot.

By the way, I also see this error here, but there is no resolution.
https://bamboo.developer.atlassian.com/browse/JCHART-STABLE-114/log
fields.summary: Mock error when building JCharting plugin 3.14.2

fields.description:
There's a lot of white space in most of the gadgets, both legacy and new. Specifically, you could reclaim about 1cm back at the bottom of each gadget, just by moving the edit/refresh controls into the header. I'm all for "breathing room" and good UX designs, but this just leaves gaping holes.

An example of what I consider a gadget that uses space well is Create Issue.
fields.summary: Excess white space in gadgets

fields.description:
In JIRA 3 I can create an issue without leaving the keyboard:

{{ctrl+alt+c <tab> JIRA <tab> Bu <tab> <tab> Enter}}

In JIRA 4.0b2 the "Create Issue" link has been replaced with a Javascript drop-down:

!createissue.png!

Although the access key still works, the project list isn't selected automatically so you can't just begin typing.  The tab order appears broken, so I cannot tab down to the Issue Type field and Create button.
fields.summary: Cannot create issues via keyboard

fields.description:
I've patiently waited for beta2, assuming this must be on the to-fix list, but perhaps not.  Is it just me, or is the invisible-until-you-mouseover portlet border thing extremely ugly and irritating?

Firstly, *ugly* because its invisible presence causes the portlets to appear vertically unaligned and randomly positioned: 

!jira4b2dashboard.png!

Secondly, *irritating* because the border and title (which is huge) constantly flashes when I move the mouse over to click on something.  If I'm clicking on the 4th portlet down I get 4 different portlet borders flashing on and off.
fields.summary: Irritating grey border on portlets flashing on mouseover

fields.description: Group picker not working in Roles Admin section.  The hidden field params seem to be there but nothing happens when clicking hte group icon.  It works in the navigator.
fields.summary: Group picker not working in Roles Admin section

fields.description:
The following clauses refer to fields with date values. The naming is not consistent. Either we change updated to updatedate and created to createdate or remove the "date" suffix from the other fields.

I vote for to remove the date suffix, since the name of these clauses indicates already that they refer to timestamp value. There is already "resolution" clause, hence we have to rename resolutiondate to "resolved".

updated
created
duedate
resolutiondate

The documentation has to be updated accordingly. Currently the documentation mentions a "resolved" clause, which doesn't exist.
fields.summary: JQL Clause naming convention inconsistent for clauses that refer to date values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18079].
  {panel}

When trying to "Edit" a filter, meaning update the query, my logical path would be as follows:
# Click on the filter taking me to *Issue Navigator*
# Click on "*Edit* current filter details" under *Operations*

However, this only let's me edit the name, description, and permissions:
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-kesfb94rpd4ju6gymx387eh1kf.png!

Requiring me to click another "Edit" option located somewhere else.

Then, after making changes to the filter AND running it, I have to click back to "View" in order to click "Save" in the *Operations* menu where I started.
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-8bx2y9g4re36s1aaaxt98c5gju.png!


This flow could be improved and/or clarified with more clear instructions.
fields.summary: Two "Edit" filter options lead to confusion

fields.description:
When adding text to 'description' or 'comment' fields, new lines are not honored. (break)

The second paragraph break appears directly below the first paragraph... however, the 2 + N paragraph displays properly. (break)

See.
fields.summary: Test input areas do not properly format new lines

See http://www.softwaretesting.de/jira-demo/secure/Dashboard.jspa using MSIE 6

Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 is still widely used, in particular in larger corporations so compatibility to MSIE is a must-have.
fields.summary: Dashboard does not render with MSIE 6

fields.description:
It would be really nice if we could export a dashboard to a word, excel, pdf, etc format like you can with your search results.

Note: This is similar to JRA-10898.
fields.summary: Ability to Export Dashboards

fields.description: The new + Create Issue button should default to the current project if it used from a project screen. For example, I work exclusively in the Sysadmin project, and am used to the add issue button historically defaulting to that project. It appears that the + Create Issue button doesnt' follow this behaviour.
fields.summary: Create issue button should be aware of the current project

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* Add task
* Add subtask
* From parent task select the subtask's 'Actions->Assign to Me' drop-down

Result:
* The issue is assigned but you are sent to assignment page that shows an error saying the issue is already assigned to you
fields.summary: Using 'Assign to Me' dropdown on subtask shows error after assignment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18042].
  {panel}

Feature Request from a customer: 

{quote}
Is there any way to visualize (Table) whats the PLANNED (Future) Workload for a user/developer.
Should give at least following info:


|| Resource 1 || Mon || Tue || Wed || Thu || Fri || Mon 1{color:#339966}(Today){color} || Tue 2 || Wed 3 || Thu 4 || Fri 5 || Mon 8 || Tue 9 || Wed 10 || Thu 11 || Fri 12 ||
|| TST-1 | 8h | 2h | 1h  | 2h | 2h | 1h | 6h | 3h | 5h | 2h | 1h | 6h | 3h | 5h | 2h ||
|| TST-2 | 0h | 2h  | 3h | 2h  | 2h | 3h | 2h | 3h | {color:red}5h{color} | 2h | 3h | 2h | 3h | {color:#ff0000}5h{color} | 2h ||
|| XYZ-3 | 0h | 2h | 2h | 2h | 2h | 2h | {color:red}2h{color} | 2h | 0h | 2h | 2h | {color:red}2h{color} | 2h | {color:#ff0000}5h{color} | 2h ||
|| PSP-4 | 0h | 2h  | 2h | 2h | 2h \\ | 1h | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | 2h | 1h | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | 2h ||
|| Sum | *8h*  | *8h* | *8h* | *8h*  | *8h* | *7h* | *11h* | *9h* | *11h* | *8h* | *7h* | *11h* | *11h* | *16h* | *8h* ||

The red estimates show where the ressource is more than fully streched.
{quote}

There are plugins that do the historical part, and the developer workload shows how much work a user has remaining but not the breakdown day by day.
fields.summary: Historical and Future Planned Workload report

fields.description:
Please change the words:
"*You must login .*" 
to:
"*You must log in.*" 

That's 2 changes:
* "log in" should be 2 words, not one.
* Remove the extra space before the full stop.

(i) The use of "Login" as one word in "Login Required" is correct.


Current text:
{quote}
Login Required
You are not logged in.
You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must login .
If you think this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Fix text on "Login Required" screen

fields.description:
If you view a saved filter, and then modify the search criteria, and then set/edit the filter's column order, the search criteria get reset to the saved criteria.

For example, I have a filter for my unresolved tickets.  If I change the criteria to my unresolved tickets where status = New, and then click "Edit Column Order", I lose the filter on status.
fields.summary: Editing column order reverts filter criteria

fields.description: The artifact com.atlassian.jira:atlassian-jira-webapp:3.13.5 is missing from the Atlassian Maven repository (http://maven.atlassian.com/repository/).
fields.summary: JIRA 3.13.5 artifacts missing from Maven repository

fields.description:
Issues:

1. The current documentation for JQL says 1. On the top navigation bar, click the 'Find Issues' tab. This will display the Search panel.

Expected:

1. It should be only "Issues" tab.
fields.summary: JQL: The "Issue" tab info need to be updated in documentation

fields.description:
Steps:.
1. Login to JIRA.
2. In JQL, type query "duedate = now()". Or replace duedate with any field for which no autocomplete(description,summary) is there. Now place space.
3. The Auto complete dialog will show "OR" ,"AND" and "ORDER BY"
4. start deleting the text.

Result:
1. When the user focus is on now(), then also it keep on showing the auto complete with "AND, OR and OrderBy" operator.

Expected:
1. The Auto complete drop down should close once focus in some other text.
fields.summary: JQL: Auto complete doesn't get refresh while deleting search string in particular scenario.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Run query like duedate = 

Result:
1. No auto complete option is there.

Expected:
1. Now() function should be there as that is a valid option for date field.
fields.summary: JQL: Auto complete should display now() function as option for date field.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login JIRA as userA. Suppose the user has a filter name "myissue" which is private.
2. There is another userB having filter with same name and shared with everybody.
3. Now userA runs a JQL query filter = myissue.

Result:
1. It return the issues for both filter.

Expected:
1. If user is not aware of shared filter, it can lead to confusion. A better handling is appreciated.
fields.summary: JQL: Searching on filter(Ex..my issue) as login user, also return the issues of other filter of same name shared by other user.
Firefox: In the issue navigator, the description of the issue type in the issue type list does not pop up

fields.description:
Steps:
1. JIRA support creation of same name custom fields.
2. Suppose customer JIRA instance is shared across multiple team having different project administrators.
3. It can happen that same name custom field is used by other project to create another type of custom field.
4. Suppose the name of field is milestoneDate. Now try to query for field in JQL

Result:
1. The autocomplete will list the custom field as many time as it is defined in JIRA. But as nothing is prefix or suffix with it, it can confuse user.

Expected:
1. Better handling of custom fields having same name.
fields.summary: JQL: Better handling of custom fields having same name in auto complete list.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Suppose user has a custom field of name "project". We had a valid customer data where customer was using a custom field of this name.
3. Click on "issues" tab and click on "Advanced" tab.
4. Try to write a query which uses custom field 'project'.

Result:
1. There is only one project in auto complete list. It can confuse user as we have auto complete support for custom fields.
2. Plus if somebody is writing query in JQL search dialog, getting the ID of custom field is not easy, until they decide to write query in simple view and get in advanced view.

Expected:
1. Support should be there for custom field having same name as system field.
fields.summary: JQL: No auto complete support for custom fields having same name as system fields

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA. Suppose user has a filter having query "project = ABC" saved as JQL.
2. Now due to some changes in organization, the project ABC no long exist.
3. User want to edit and change the search criteria in the same filter.
4. User click on that filter in "Manage" tab.


Result:
1. Now user is in "Edit" tab, the query is opened in advanced dialog and error message says "The value 'Test JQL' does not exist for the field 'project'.". Which is right behavior.
2. Now user has edited the query as "project=XYZ", where XYZ is valid project. Click the search button to execute the query.
3. Now there is no option on left tab which says the filter has modified and goto "view" to save it.


Expected:
1. The user should able to edit the filter in all conditions.
fields.summary: JQL: No editing support for invalid search saved as filter.
Create a navigable field for "watches" that shows the total number of watchers for an issue

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as admin to JIRA.
2. Click on project role browser link.
3. Create another role and click Manage Default Members to edit.
4. Click "Edit" to edit the groups.
5. Click the "Group Picker" icon to open the group picker.

Result:
1. Nothing happens.
2. If user type group name and click "Add" it works.

Expected:
1. Group picker should get open and user should able to add group.
fields.summary: Group picker is not working for "Project Role Browser".

fields.description:
During a CSV import, it appears that custom date fields will only:
1) parse correctly, if they match jira.date.picker.java.format.
2) validate correctly, if jira.date.time.picker.java.format matches date.import.format.

They should both parse and validate correctly if they match date.import.format.

This does not apply to system date fields which do parse and validate correctly if they match date.import.format.
fields.summary: Problems with CSV import of custom date fields

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Create custom fields of type user picker, project picker, multi user picker, version picker.
3. In the JQL search dialog, create query with custom field of user type/project picker/version picker.

Result:
1. User doesn't get option as auto complete.

Expected:
1. It will be great if we decide to extend the support to custom field using project values.
fields.summary: JQL: It will be great if we show auto complete options for custom fields using project information like project picker, user picker

fields.description:
Add the Select List CF and Radio Buttons CF.
Execute a search on the IssueNavigator via the URL and specify invalid values for these custom fields.
The validation fails and the error message will cause the Navigator form take up to 90% of the window space.
fields.summary: Select List CF and Radio Buttons CF Validation responses with very long error message

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Try to write a query as filter = 

Result:
1. User get "Current user() and now()" function as auto complete options.

Expected:
1. As these option are irrelevant in regards to filter, we should n't be displaying it.
2. As there is no support of Auto complete for filter, no option should be displayed.
fields.summary: JQL: In Auto complete we should not be displaying any option after user has selected filter keyword.

As a result the legacy portlets for the fishey plugin are not available in the directory.
fields.summary: Legacy portlet gadget bridge not working due to an issue loading i18n resources
Scheduled backups that fail to complete within a certain time period should provide indications

fields.description:
Backups that never complete (e.g., sql server hangs and never replies) will leave behind partial backup files that are not identified as corrupted.  

I would propose that backup files are created in the "corrupted" folder, and moved out to the proper backup directory only after they have been verified as complete.  A corrupted until proven valid mindset if you will...

For some more background on how we've discovered this issue, we've uncovered an issue with the VM's we are running in that there is an abnormally high percentage of packets being dropped.  This is causing random queries to hang when using JIRA.  The backup system in this case causes a very high number of queries, making it almost guaranteed that the query system will hang during the backup process.  I have used remote debugging in Eclipse to confirm that the particular backup thread ends up hung waiting for data from the SQL server (readSocket0).
fields.summary: Failed backups are not identified as corrupted

fields.description:
I was showing Brian L and he said to raise this issue and assign it to you Mike.

Basically I really like the footer links on Bamboo that have

Report a Problem    Request a Feature


The first links into SAC with the right project ids and the latter links into JAC.


It would be create if we could also set the fix for and insert the environment information etc.... as part of the link!
fields.summary: Footer improvements - like Bamboo

fields.description: When clicking on 'Create Issue' in the upper right part of my JIRA screen, I get the attached jumbled image.
fields.summary: Jumbled 'Create Issue' Display

fields.description:
I try to keep my fingers on the home row as much as possible.  I appreciate the new look in this release, but the pop-up menus are really hampering my productivity.  

I can use Firefox's find as you type (1) feature to navigate to the Create Issue link.  I simply type ' (apostrophe) to specify that I want to search links, then type "Create Issue", then press enter to "click" the link.  The new pop-up screen shows up, but I can't navigate it with the keyboard.  Even if I type /Project to bring my cursor above the form, I can't tab through the form fields.  

1.  http://www.mozilla.org/access/type-ahead/
fields.summary: New "Create Issue" screen is not accessible via keyboard

fields.description:
Import from JIRA version 3.13.2 failed because of a Database error 
ORA-01461 can bind a LONG value only for insert into a LONG column,
following the instruction here  : http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/ORA-01461+can+bind+a+LONG+value+only+for+insert+into+a+LONG+column

Results in the import/export option missing from the menu after a restart, and there are several sub-menu items that are also not appearing.
fields.summary: Import/Export menu item missing

fields.description:
I've ran some tests on JIRA and observed the behavior below:

    * Single transition, screen with random fields: JIRA shows the fields and the field "comment", which is not part of the screen.
    * Single transition, empty screen: JIRA shows the field "comment".
    * Bulk change running a transition, screen with random fields: JIRA shows the fields and the field "comment", which is not part of the screen.
    * Bulk change running a transition, empty screen: JIRA shows no field and perform the transition.
      Once the behavior on single transition and bulk change is the same if you have a screen with random fields, I would like that the behavior was the same if you have an empty screen.
      I can't accept the proposed solution because I'll have to change a lot of transitions on my workflows, just to add a field that is already shown. It makes no sense for me.
fields.summary: Comments on bulk change

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
-Make sure you are logged out 
-Query the Issue Navigator via this URL /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reporterSelect=issue_current_user&reset=true

No validation error appears - it should say that the currentUser function can't be used when not logged in.

The same problem happens for the assignee field.

fields.description:

1. Login to JIRA.
2. Go To issues tab and click "Advanced".
3. Type Summary is  or duedate is ". Press space after is to write the next option.

Result:
1. It keep on showing you the autocomplete drop down with option "is not" for operator "is" wherever there is no next value to show.
2. Like if we use the same operator with assignee, this problem is not there.

Expected:
1. Auto complete option should get close when user move to next value in search string.
fields.summary: JQL: Auto complete doesn't get close for "is" operator when there is no values to show next.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Run a search query on any system or custom date field as duedate="15/07/09" or duedate>="15/07/09"
3. User has a valid issue with the above due date.

Result:
1. It  runs the query without any error message. In the second, it actually return the issue as result too.

Expected:
1. Proper error handling should be there as this date format is not supported in JQL query.
fields.summary: JQL: dd-mm-yy is getting accepted as valid date format in date search with no correct results.

2. Search for sub-tasks
3. save filter

5. load filter

Note you are directed to simple even though the error message of the disabled function can not be displayed there.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Write a query like assignee in memeber of ("JIRA-users").
3 Click on search to run the query.

Result:
1. It give error message "Function 'membersOf' can not generate a list of usernames for group 'JIRA-users'; the group does not exist.
2. The group name parameter in member of function is case sensitive.

Expected:
1. Like all places in JQL, group name should be not case sensitive.
fields.summary: JQL: MemberOf funtcion in JQL is case sensitive

When a search term contains angle brackets: [x, y] I get the following message:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090721-nqd8sj6wybskqrf64k47wmbbn5.jpg!

This could be related to: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3895 ?

A quick short-term fix could be maybe be to change error message to suggest the user surround the query with "quotation marks".
fields.summary: "Could not parse the query text." when Quick Search field contains [x, y]

fields.description:
The TestSorting.testOrderByClauseNameResolvesToMultipleFields fails some of the time.

The issue appears to be that we are trying to sort with a custom field ("NF") that belongs to two different custom fields. We make assumptions about which one field will be used first and which will be used second. This appears to be non-deterministic as I guess we are registering the fields in the DefaultSearchHandlerManager in some non-deterministic way (maybe by looking up all the fields through the custom field manager which uses a hash map?).

Good luck.
fields.summary: The order of a search using a custom field name is non determinisitc.
Documentation for createusers mail handler parameter is incorrect

fields.description:
In Jira you can have notifications come from different from addresses depending on what project they're in.  So, you _do_ set up a default from address when configuring your SMTP server under Administration --> Mail Servers, but it can be over-ridden when administering a specific project.  

I found that if I used an SMTP server configured completely in via Jira's web interface (not using SSL), this worked as I would have expected.  Notifications came from the address specified on a per project basis.  

On the same data set, when I deleted that mail server, and switched it to a gmail SMTP configuration (JNDI), the email address I specified in the JNDI configuration always overrode the project specific settings.
fields.summary: When using an SMTP server configured as a JNDI resource, projects' "Mail Configuration" email address ignored
Allow global share to be disabled or restricted

fields.description: When there is only one project, if you make an advanced search that has a single clause for a version of that single project, the user is allowed to move to simple mode but the version is not selected in the version field.
fields.summary: Context checks on "does it fit" fails when there is only one project

fields.description: The login gadget never successfully logs in under the current version of Safari. To login you have to use the login link at the top of the page to activate the legacy login code
fields.summary: Login gadget does not work under Safari 4.0.2

fields.description:
I had a 4.0 BETA instance where the index directory was no longer valid.  

When I went to the issue navigator it did....nothing.  It seems like I had NO issues as opposed to no index.

The old code you to crash with a 500 statck trace (BAD) but at least you know the indexes where bad.

We need to handle this better from a support impact point of view.

That or stop pretending that JIRA can run without an index!


Brenden asked me to raise this against JQL.  I am not sure its the culprit however.
fields.summary: PART 2: Un activated Index directory has bad Issue navigator behaviour

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA.
2. Create/update an issue and enter value in description field. Say
   text
  {noformat}xxx{noformat}
3. Click the "Preview" icon to see the value in preview mode.
4. Click "Create"/"Update".

Result:
1. The issue just get created with summary and data in description field is lost.
2. This is a critical issue as user is here loosing data if saved in preview mode.

Expected:
1. No loss of data

Additional Info:
Working fine on JAC
fields.summary: Contents of Description field get lost if saved in preview mode

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Click on "Issues" tab.
2. Click "advanced" link to go to JQL search dialog.
3. Type some query say project = Abc and assignee = . User has list of options to choose from auto complete drop down.
4. Click ESC to dismiss the auto complete dialog.

Result:
1. It closes the auto complete dialog plus also delete the search string from JQL search dialog

Expected:
1. Only the Auto complete dialog should get close.

Additional Info:
1. Same behavior is there for user picker.
fields.summary: JQL: Pressing ESC to dismiss the auto complete drop down in JQL search window remove the search string also in IE
Implement tabs in AG
Housekeeping - Raise and do all crucible reviews
Remove duplicate dependencies currently included in the activity stream

fields.description:
When you create a search based off the standard text fields (description, environment, comments, summary), sort order is removed intentionally to allow Lucene to do its thing (order by relevance).
You can then do a sort.  Though any change to the criteria or "View & Hide" will result in the sort disappearing.

It would be nice to have the search persisted for that search until it is specifically removed.
fields.summary: Search sort order doesn't persist when searching on free text

fields.description:
*REQ: Sys admin trying to create a project for XYZ project manager and there a permission scheme ABC for same*
Steps:
1. On the administration tab, click "Add Project". Specify project name.
2. Choose a custom avatar for the project.
3. Specify the lead as XYZ and choose the permission scheme as ABC.
4. Click "Add"

Result
1. JIRA fails with stack trace..."java.lang.IllegalStateException: You can not update a project with an invalid validation result.
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.updateProject(DefaultProjectService.java:218)"
2. Detail stack trace is attached.
3. If user browse the project, the project is created with default avatar.
4. This error is happening due to issue JRA-16515.

Expected:
1. No Error message, the project should get created with custom avatar.
fields.summary: project Avatar: Trying to create a project with custom avatar and custom permission scheme give java.lang.IllegalStateException error

fields.description: We can have user having same full name or e-mail ID's. JQL support searching based on full name and e-mail ID. Hence if user search with assignee = "veenu bharara" and if there are 2 users having same full name, the result will show the issues assigned to both user.
fields.summary: JQL handling of same name and e-mail address for user name field needs to be documented

We need to implement the sorting feature to the headers of Report. Is there any mechanism in place to handle (OR) In which we can achieve this?
fields.summary: Need to implement sorting option for the newly developed plug-in
